before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1qls","text":"Prepare a sufficient number of slides by washing them thoroughly in distilled water with detergent and then in pure ethanol before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n4hq","text":"Carry out a control treatment and an autophagy-inducing treatment of your choice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bgue","text":"Install the Sampling Window plugin [4] in Fiji.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"te77","text":"The workflow enables the quantification of autophagosomes in Arabidopsis thaliana root epidermal cells in 3D. It combines immunolabeling of an autophagosome marker ATG8 with commercially available anti-ATG antibody and the subsequent stereological quantification of the immunolabeled particles. The immunolabeled samples are imaged with a confocal microscope and Z-stacks are acquired. The stereological methods involve counting of the immunolabeled autophagosomes using the optical disector and the determination of volume of the examined tissue with the Cavalieri principle and point counting. The image analysis is performed entirely in Fiji and requires no further special software. The method provides a powerful toolkit for unbiased and reproducible quantification of autophagosomes and offers a convenient alternative to the standard of live imaging with FP-ATG8 markers.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":61,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4i38","text":"      \nMicrotubule-stabilizing buffer (MTSB) [1] is used throughout the procedure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":45,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ulc","text":"Composition: 50 mM PIPES, 5 mM EGTA, 5 mM MgSO4.7H2O, pH = 6.8 (5M KOH). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":46,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":50,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e167p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hq6j","text":"Note: PIPES will not dissolve in water unless the solution is alkalized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qhsb","text":"PFA [2] is depolymerized in MTSB-T by heating the solution to 75 °C in a covered container in a fume hood to obtain a final concentration of 4 % (w/v). It is let cool down to the laboratory temperature. If the solution volume is reduced due to evaporation during heating, the original volume is topped up with water.\nThe solution is filtered through 0.22 µm syringe filter to remove traces of undepolymerized PFA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2avfu","text":"Add Triton X-100 to 0.1 % final concentration (v/v) to obtain MTSB-T. Mix well using a magnetic stirrer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fus43","text":"1 mL of fixation solution is pipetted in wells of the 24-well plate. The incubation baskets are placed in the wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flqvg","text":"Treated seedlings (whole seedlings can be used up to 4 days of age) or detached root tips of approximately 2 cm (in the case of older seedlings) are put in the incubation baskets. Six whole seedlings or 8-10 detached roots can fit into one basket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8br8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ppa1","text":"Note: The required time is estimated for preparation of two variants, each comprising ca.15 - 20 roots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fm8g","text":"Fixation is carried out for 1 hour at the room temperature. To terminate the fixation the baskets are moved to wells of the Intavis specimen holder (equipment of the InSituPro VS station), each containing 600 µL of MTSB-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pbnj","text":"The specimen holder is mounted in the automated station and the steps 3 – 9 are carried out in the station. The volume of each solution pipetted per one incubation basket is 600 µL. The following steps are set up in the pipetting protocol editor:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bggk7","text":"Initial rinse and equilibration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c74u","text":"15 mins with MTSB-T, room temperature; repeat 5 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7eja","text":"15 mins with 0.1 % Triton X-100 in water, room temperature; repeat 5 times  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tpq3","text":"Cell wall digestion (+ wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpaun","text":"30 mins with 0.05 % pectolyase in MTSB-T (w/v), 37 °C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a152","text":"15 mins with MTSB-T, room temperature; repeat 5 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5i8u","text":"Membrane permeabilization (+ wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lqj8","text":"30 mins with 10 % DMSO + 3 % Igepal CA-630 in MTSB-T (v/v), room temperature;\nrepeat twice","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9eana","text":"15 mins with MTSB-T, room temperature; repeat 5 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fv8vh","text":"Blocking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8imcs","text":"1 hour with 2 % BSA in MTSB-T (w/v), room temperature","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"745qc","text":"Primary antibody incubation (+ wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6ui2","text":"6 hours with anti-ATG8 diluted 1:1000 in 2 % BSA in MTSB-T (filtered through 0.22\nµm syringe filter to remove aggregates), 37 °C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m8lh","text":"15 mins with MTSB-T, room temperature; repeat 8 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tqh2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m96r","text":"Note: The primary antibody solution can be kept and re-used a few times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a0fc","text":"Secondary antibody incubation (+ wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckm3p","text":"5 hours with anti-rabbit-DyLight488 diluted 1:1000 in 2 % BSA in MTSB-T (filtered\nthrough 0.22 µm syringe filter to remove aggregates), 37 °C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8gok","text":"15 mins with MTSB-T, room temperature; repeat 5 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3shnk","text":"15 mins with water, room temperature; repeat 5 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5tl","text":"CalcoFluor White counterstaining (+ final wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pdbi","text":"20 mins with 0.002 % CalcoFluor White in water, room temperature","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b33gp","text":"15 mins with water, room temperature; repeat 8 times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aucnc","text":"Samples in baskets are removed from the pipetting station and put in wells of a 24-well plate each containing 1 mL 50 % glycerol (v/v).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lt9m","text":"Strips of one layer of Parafilm are pressed onto microscope slides in order to prevent direct contact between the slide and coverslip and to avoid mechanical damage to the roots. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qud","text":"Immunolabeled roots are carefully removed from the incubation baskets using tweezers and mounted on slides. A dissecting microscope may be necessary to locate the roots in the baskets. 50 % glycerol (v/v) is used as the mounting medium. Sodium azide (0.02 %) can be added to the mounting medium for long-term storage of specimens (several months) in the cold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"282q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90rp3","text":"Note: The required time is estimated for the preparation of two variants, each comprising ca. 15 - 20 roots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3e3hl","text":"A spinning disk confocal microscope or scanning confocal microscope is used for observation. A 40x objective provides sufficiently detailed view.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bil5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v9ho","text":"Z-stacks are recorded in the meristermatic and/or differentiation zone of the root. The Z-step is set to 500 nm. The first slide of the Z-stack is placed above the surface of the root. Calcofluor White signal is used  to determine the correct position. The number of Z-steps within a Z-stack is set to exceed the minimum number of Z-steps required to construct the disector with the desired Z-dimension. This enables the correct placement of the disector upon visual assessment of the surrounding tissue. If the Z-dimension of the disector is 7.5 µm, the minimum number of Z-steps is 21.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m5v2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o5bg","text":"Note 1: Other disector dimensions can be chosen. The number of Z-steps is then adjusted accordingly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ftph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmjkm","text":"Note 2: The required time is estimated for the imaging of two variants, each comprising ca. 15 - 20 roots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsq3h","text":"The quantification is run in Fiji [3]. Sampling Window plugin [4], enabling the construction of a disector [5], needs to be installed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":34,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":62,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":107,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57shp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpu2v","text":"Disector construction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44cmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3h5nt","text":"(i) A Z-stack is opened in Fiji.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b76ih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajpei","text":"(ii) Disector plugin is launched: Plugins\u003eDisector.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rnvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qhni","text":"(iii) Disector (x; y; z) dimensions are set to (50; 50; 7.5) µm in the meristematic zone, and to (150; 150; 7.5) µm in the differentiation zone. The X and Y dimensions are set as \"Width\" and \"Height\" in the Disector dialog window. The Z dimesnion is set as the number of slides with \"First slide\" and \"Last slide\" box. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"328vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7vvk","text":"(iv) Disector position in the X and Y direction within a Z-stack is adjusted with \"Horizontal offset\" and \"Vertical offset\" box. Disector position in the Z direction is adjusted with \"First slide\" and \"Last slide\" box. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68n94","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkje5","text":"Note: Other disector dimensions can be set. Accordingly, several smaller disectors can be placed within one Z-stack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fad4l","text":"Optical disector principle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6m12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff94","text":"An appropriately set disector appears on the first selected slide and remains present until the last selected slide and on all slides in between. Disector projection on each slide has a shape of a square delimited with two exclusion (solid) lines and two inclusion (dashed) lines. Similarly, two planes delimit a disector in the Z direction. The first and the last slide set up in the previous step represent the reference (inclusion) and look-up (exclusion) plane, respectively [6].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":479,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2ull","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65v7j","text":"Counting autophagosomes using optical disector","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4e1n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpnjv","text":"A disector delineates the region of interest within a Z-stack in which the autophagosomes are counted. An individual particle appearing anywhere in the disector volume starting from the reference plane (i.e. the first slide) is included in the autophagosome count if both of the following conditions are met:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gv1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r099","text":"(i) a particle appears within the disector volume and disapears again before the look-up plane (i.e. the last slide) is reached. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rjf7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gbrm","text":"(ii) a particle that lies at the disector boundaries is included if it is intersected by the inclusion (dashed) line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ps72","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m39e","text":"Particles intesected with the exclusion (solid) lines and particles present at the look-up plane (the last slide) are not included in the number of autophagosomes [6].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":163,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0h7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s427","text":"The disector volume is observed by scrolling up and down within a given Z-stack. Each particle theat appears within the disector volume is visually tracked and it is counted by clicking on it using e.g. Multi poins selection tool or Cell counter tool of Fiji.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14nlm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"688tm","text":"Note: The required time is estimated for the analysis of two variants, each comprising ca. 15 - 20 roots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnkqa","text":"Assessment of tissue volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51lvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a72da","text":"The volume of the disector is calculated by multiplying its (x; y; z) dimensions. If the entire space of the disector is fully filled with the examined tissue, the disector volume is equal to the tissue volume and the number of autophagosomes is directly related to the disector volume: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0vsj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t88h","text":"                       ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"99qb1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ntur","text":"E. g., if the disector (x; y; z) dimensions are equal to (50; 50; 7.5) µm in the meristematic zone, the volume of the disector is: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4thr8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvjqf","text":"  ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1s5je","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j8s0","text":"If only a part of the examined tissue lies within the disector, the volume of such an intersection is counted by combination of the Cavalieri principle and the point-counting method.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45k8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6o69","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2viua","text":"Assessment of tissue volume by the Cavalieri principle and point counting","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fks1q","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68e9n","text":"The volume of the intersection of the examined tissue and the disector is estimated by counting the number of regularly distributed points in selected Z-slides [6]. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":160,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4edte","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rul8","text":"(i) After autophagosomes have been counted in step 20, the opened Z-stack with apllied disector must not be closed. Subsequent point-counting procedure is performed on it.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vgn6","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb9vj","text":"(ii) A 2D grid is generated and superimposed over the opened image using the Grid tool in Fiji: Analyze\u003eTools\u003eGrid. The parametr \"Area per point\" is set to 300 µm2 in the dialog box.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":162,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ji9k","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tudd","text":"(iii) The points of the grid superimposed over the examinated tissue within the disector are counted using e.g. Multi poins selection tool. The points of the grid that do not lie in the tissue are excluded. Points are counted in individual slides within the disector but it is not necessary to use all the slides. Counting points at every third slide (i. e. with 1.5 µm distance between two neighboring slides where the points are counted) should provide a sufficiently accurate estimate of the volume. At least 200 points in total should be counted to get a good estimate. The position of the first slide where the points are counted is randomly selected from the first to the third slide within the disector.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ht53","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eni6s","text":"(iv) The estimate of the volume of the examined tissue within the disector is calculated as [6]:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":92,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3sh2","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pu5j","text":"                        ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"als3c","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0r3c","text":"where estV is the estimator of volume in µm3, T is the distance between two neighboring optical sections where the points have been counted, a is the area in µm2 represented by one testing point of the testing grid, and Pj is the number of testing points hitting the j-th (j = 1, 2, …, n) optical section. If the above indicated values are set, then: ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":46,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":141,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":220,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":286,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":43,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":160,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":221,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i76b","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etn5k","text":"                        ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bh132","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hsqu","text":"Note: The required time is estimated for analysis of two variants, each comprising ca. 15 - 20 roots.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"V=x ⋅ y ⋅ z","guid":"","id":0}},"1":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"[V ]=µm^3","guid":"","id":0}},"2":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"V=50 ⋅ 50⋅7.5 \\; µm^3=18 \\ 750  \\; µm^3","guid":"","id":0}},"3":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"estV=T\\cdot a\\cdot  \\sum_{j=1}^{n}P_j","guid":"","id":0}},"4":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"[estV ]=µm^3","guid":"","id":0}},"5":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"a = 300\\ µm^2","guid":"","id":0}},"6":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"T = 1.5\\ µm","guid":"","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ficn7","text":"Estimation of the number of autophagosomes per volume of tissue ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff9lq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eg45","text":"The number of autophagosomes counted in step 20 is finally related to the volume of the tissue determined in step 21 according to: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q3h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap2sn","text":"                                  ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ebfcr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hepm","text":"where N is the number of autophagosomes and V is the volume of the disector in µm3 . If the disector is not completely filled with the examined tissue, the estimate of volume estV determined by the Cavalieri principle and point counting is used in the equation instead:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":175,"length":5},{"style":"sup","offset":81,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnnjg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20m0d","text":"                        ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj6jj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cmr8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"estN_V=(N/V) \\cdot10^6","guid":"","id":0}},"1":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"[estN_V]=particles\\cdot10^{-6}  \\ µm^{-3}","guid":"","id":0}},"2":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"estN_V=(N/estV) \\cdot10^6","guid":"","id":0}},"3":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"[estN_V]=particles\\cdot10^{-6}  \\ µm^{-3}","guid":"","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70flb","text":"Statistical evaluation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqnku","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"592n7","text":"To assess putative differences in observed data, appropriate statistical anylysis is performed. The t-test or Wilcoxon test is used to detect differences between two treatments or genotypes, and the ANOVA or Kruskal–Wallis test is applied when more than two variants are compared. 10 - 15 samples are usually sufficient for a statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0hdo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Wholemount immunolabeling and stereological quantification of autophagosomes in Arabidopsis thaliana root epidermal cells
title_html: Wholemount immunolabeling and stereological quantification of autophagosomes in Arabidopsis thaliana root epidermal cells

versions.title: Wholemount immunolabeling and stereological quantification of autophagosomes in Arabidopsis thaliana root epidermal cells
versions.title_html: Wholemount immunolabeling and stereological quantification of autophagosomes in Arabidopsis thaliana root epidermal cells

creator.name: Michal Danek
creator.affiliation: Institute of Experimental Botany of the Czech Academy of Sciences, Rozvojová 263, 165 00 Prague, Czech Republic

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7t5c","text":"Autophagy induction can be triggered by relatively small alterations in the conditions under which plants occur. This may contribute to an increase in autophagy already at the beginning of an experiment or under control conditions. Such an increase can then reduce the difference in autophagy intensity between treatments/variants. Avoid exposing plants to additional stress that may occur when samples are collected prior to the fixation step. Plants can induce autophagy when brought into the lab from controlled conditions in a growth chamber and when left on the lab bench for extended periods of time. Try to handle the plant material as quickly and as gently as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
